name: Eryngium
description: Eryngium, also known as Sea Holly, is a genus of about 250 species in the family Apiaceae, mostly native to the Mediterranean. Most of these species are perennials, but some are annuals.They produce showy and attractive thistle-like flower heads surrounded by spiny silvery-blue bracts on strong stems. These sun-loving plants will bloom in summer and attract butterflies and bees to your garden.
meaning: The origin of the genus name “Eryngium” is somewhat obscure, but is thought to derive from an ancient Greek name used for a plant Eryngium campestre. The name was used by Theophrastus, who was known as the father of botany in 350 BC. Eryngium is commonly known as “Sea Holly” because of its spiky, silvery leaves.
color_description: Eryngiums are usually blue, purple, green or whitish.
